model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker B, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes" or "No"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I loaded up on repellent like you said and I also grabbed a few of those mosquito repellent bracelets, I figured why not!
Speaker B: Have you been hiking lately?
Speaker A: Yes I did actually. I lead some friends on a hike in a local trail last weekend. They got tired really quickly as they never go hiking they told me.
Speaker B: Sounds like me. I am not a fan of the outdoors. Did your friends manage to have a good time anyway?
Speaker A: Oh they did. We had some nice snacks along the way. Oddly enough, we had some trail mix that someone had made at home. It was quite tasty. We also had some juice and water packed to make sure everyone stayed hydrated. You should join us one day! I'll make it as fun as possible.
Speaker B: I will someday. just not in the summer when all the bugs are out! Where do you go hiking the most?
Speaker A: I like to go hiking in the local trails here. I am familiar with them and there's so many routes that I can take. Sadly, the bugs are as bad here as they are anywhere else.....
Speaker B: They can't be that bad in the fall right? I hope? Do you camp most every weekend?
Speaker A: A least a couple of times a month. Sometimes, yeah, I go every weekend to relax. Being in nature is so relaxing to me. And nah the bugs aren't too bad in the fall and winter. There's a beautiful river along one trail that I bet you'd love to see. 
Speaker B: That sounds like it would be relaxing. I would probable be okay if we didn't run into any wolves, bears etc. Have you ever came across any predators when you were camping?
Speaker A: Oh I've seen bears and even a mountain lion. Luckily, it was a far away encounter and they didn't know that we were there. As soon as I saw them we changed directions fairly quickly but quietly. Don't worry, I've only seen it a handful of times in my time camping.

MEMORY:
Speaker A enjoys going on camping trips and hiking trails in parks. This passion for outdoor activities has led Speaker A to plan several camping trips for the summer, including a part of the Appalachian Trail. Speaker A also leads shorter hikes for their camping group, but their upcoming Appalachian Trail hike will last for 10 days. Speaker A may even try a cruise in the future, but for now, they prefer the freedom and adventure of camping and hiking. Additionally, Speaker A enjoys searching for wild animals during their outdoor excursions, engaging in activities like birdwatching and spotting rare animals.

raw_prediction: Wow, that must have been quite the experience seeing those predators up close! I admire your bravery. I'll definitely have to join you on a hike sometime, but I hope we don't run into any wild animals like that!
prediction:
Brief explanation: The MEMORY provides information about Speaker A's enthusiasm for outdoor activities, their plans for hiking and camping, and their interest in spotting wildlife. This is relevant as it aligns with the ongoing conversation about Speaker A's hiking experiences and their encounters with wild animals in the DIALOGUE CONTEXT. Knowing that Speaker A enjoys spotting wildlife can also relate to Speaker B's query about encountering predators.

Judgement: Yes
